a rough ramp ab is fixed to horizontal ground at a.  the ramp is inclined at 20° to the 
ground.  the line ab is a line of greatest slope of the ramp and ab = 6 m.  the point b is 
at the top of the ramp, as shown in figure 3.  a particle p of mass 3 kg is projected with 
speed 15 m s–1 from a towards b.  at the instant p reaches the point b the speed of p is 
10 m s–1.  the force due to friction is modelled as a constant force of magnitude f newtons. 
	
(a)	 use the work-energy principle to find the value of f.
(6)
	
after leaving the ramp at b, the particle p moves freely under gravity until it hits the 
horizontal ground at the point c.  the speed of p as it hits the ground at c is w m s–1.
	
find
	
(b)	 (i)	 the value of w,
	
	
(ii)	 the direction of motion of p as it hits the ground at c,
(5)
	
(c)	 the greatest height of p above the ground as p moves from a to c.
